Description: Logical And node. Runs all children until it reaches a FAILURE (can allow multiple failures if desired.)
Logical Or node. Runs all children until it reaches a SUCCESS or RUNNING
Special logical And node. Stops on FAILURE, but also stops on RUNNING. Resumes next turn on RUNNING node.
Given a list of units, buildings, or techs, asks Research AI to work on them
Given a list of units and/or buildings and a city, builds 'best' unit at the city when queue is availble.
Given a list of units, finds first unit of matching type that can get to location
Sends notice back to the owning player or any other listener, with an optional integral payload.
Change the spawn rate of a barbarian tribe to prepare for raid/invasion.
DEPRECATED - DO NOT USE. Runs a behavior tree defined elsewhere. You can change data for that sub-tree, but not its structure.
Moves operation to the rally point.
For temporary trees only. Take the trigger you want to meet and extract information for use elsewhere.
Given a list of buildings, pick the best city to make a building. Output city and needed improvement.
Given a worker, location, and improvement, build the improvement.
Given a unit ID and a location, give the unit a move order. Report RUNNING until it reaches destination.
As part of an operation, attack the target.
Decorator that turns SUCCESS and RUNNING to FAILURE and vice versa. Does not reverse ERROR.
Purchase a plot for a city.
Recruit units for a defined operation. OPERATION USE ONLY.
As part of an operation, attack enemy units during a move.
Given a list of improvement types, chooses a specific improvement to build, preferably around a city
Check the score of a barbarian raid
Decorator that runs if owner's difficulty is within range. Optionally target difficulty, optionally fail if outside.
Tells a unit to perform the settle action. FAILS if no unit is able to do so.
Checks if you can build the requested building or district on that location. Outputs an offending resource or feature if it fails
Orders a unit to clear the current tile. FAILS if no unit is able to do so.
Recruit members from a tribe for a raid or invasion.
Lets a child run for n turns before rechecking it
As part of an operation, protect your units that might otherwise be destroyed.
Only lets a child node run for a limited number of turns before failing.
As part of an operation, if you can't take the current target, find a new one or give up.
Manages a contract, can limit turns until it is run.
As part of an operation, attack a city
Create (or destroy) a formation of units
Keep a non-operation unit safe if its health is below specified fraction
Cities attack enemy units within range, with preferences as described (none required)
Reserve a city plot so that other trees will leave it alone
Pillage nearby improvements and districts
Pillage nearby improvements and districts
As part of an operation, garrison a unit in a friendly city
Tell if city that is operation target is still threatened
Tell if player is at war
Find places for all owned units to go
Upgrade any upgradeable units
Succeeds if the tree has a great person of the appropriate type
Uses the great person ability, including founding a religion
Cancel a tagged contract
Allow / disallow units to be recruited off the team
Diplomatic actions and tests
Choose a spy mission for the spy's current city
Execute the spy's current mission
Move the spy to the chosen city (or home)
Have an archaeologist dig at the specified location
An archaeologist moves to his home and donates any carried artifact to his museum
Recruit naval escorts to an operation and ferry units across the waters
Decorator that checks for player ability before handing control to child
Use a builder charge to accelerate a wonder or district (if allowed)
Returns true if the specified player has launched an inquisition
Launches an inquisition using an attached unit, if possible
Checks if the AI is willing to use nukes against his opponent (Gandhi always will)
Launch nuke at target
Checks if the associated operation is ready
Build an improvement outside your own territory (usually in an operation)
Launcher bombers against target city
Choose a naval superiority target. If none available, don't run child.
Choose a naval patrol target and move accordingly.
Opportunistically attack districts and land units (naval raiding to come).
Checks that unit assigned target remains valid. Removes units with invalid targets from tree.
For shortcutting a city attack. Check if you can do 50%+ garrison damage or defense units are worth ignoring.
Returns true if any unit is within range of fallout and puts all such members in the Endangered list (if there is an operation)
Run a lua script function that returns a boolean value. Only the player is passed in to the script
Within an operation, attempt to combine units into corps and armies
If they have an available scripted command, try to use it
Finds the next hex that needs a railroad to build a road between cities
